data.title: Sunday is Brunch Day
data.text: Was in Bayonne visiting with family and looked for a place with a broad menu. This hit the varied needs list. Three women who all choose off the brunch menu. I had  a version of Eggs Benedict served over a Rueben sandwich. My sister had poached eggs over spinach Nd my aunt had a Philly Cheesesteak omelet. We all enjoyed our entrees. The mimosas and Bloody Mary were tasty too. Side of corned beef hash was different, and a bit greasy. The basket of muffins were a very nice touch.

data.title: All around good dining
data.text:
I've been here many times ,it's a friendly atmosphere and great decor.The food is great
love ,love the french onion soup,the burgers are great ,I have had many an entree
and have always been satisfied .Have lots of great beers and a great bartender.

data.title: Great dining experience
data.text: Kathleen and Chuck Murphy from Chicago highly recomend Hendriksons corner . As we were traveling the east cost we happened upon Hendricksons, we were welcomed as we walked in the restaurant by the owners ,they could tell we were not from the area walked us to our table gave us a history of the building and if I'm not mistaken it is one of in not the oldest buildings in town and has had a few presidents from years past eat there. The food,service, and atmosphere were excellent. We both enjoyed our experience at Hendricksons and visit again next time we are in the area.

data.title: A Piece of Bayonne History Enhanced
data.text:
Having lived here my entire life, it is nice to walk into Hendrickson's and enjoy the historic décor.  The new owners enhanced it rather than changed it and that was wonderful.  The staff is very accommodating and the new owners are friendly. Whether you are in a group or single there is always a comfortable place for you. You never feel like an outsider.  The menu is extensive and there is something for everyone.  Their famous steak sandwich is outstanding as are the other menu items.
It is a very warm and comfortable atmosphere.  I would highly recommend it.

data.title: Great place for traditional German fare
data.text: A mainstay of Bayonne, this friendly bar and restaurant boasts a very Germanic feel in decor and menu. The choice of draft beers is good, and you can sit in traditional wooden stalls in the bar or the extension behind for dinner. Definitely try the specialty of the house! You may put on pounds, but then the menu is from central Europe: ever seen a Hausfrau?!

data.title: A Slice of Bayonne History with Amazing Food and Drinks
data.text:
Walk into Hendrickson's Corner and you're immediately transported to Old Bayonne. Passing through its doors is like stepping back in time, with an antique-filled interior  augmented by stained glass windows and wall paintings. Throw in a friendly bar staff mixing solid drinks and an incredible, eclectic menu, and you've got all the ingredients for a wonderful night out.

The owners are rightly proud of the history of the building, which in addition to being a favorite local watering hole has also served as Bayonne's police headquarters and jail, among other uses! If you get a chance to ask them about it, they'll gladly tell you all the stories about the artwork and architecture that lend Hendrickson's so much character and charm.

The menu is full of winners, from the appetizers to the mains to the desserts. The baked buffalo wings are probably the best I've ever tasted, and the Reuben and steak sandwich are both incredible. There are usually some specials offered as well, which are always fresh and delicious, so ask the staff for their recommendations. 

In all, an evening at Hendrickson's Corner is an all-out pleasure, and I look forward to many more meals in this amazing establishment!

data.title: Great atmosphere, great food, great place
data.text:
I love Everything about Hendrickson's! Staff, owners, food, atmosphere...it has it all! The new owners have done a fabulous job of bringing back the old time feeling of this historic place. New menu items have only added to the quality of this establishment. Hendrickson's now hosts beer, wine and whiskey pairing dinners throughout the year. 
Whether you choose to go for a casual dinner, an event (catering room available), or just to kick back at your neighborhood bar, you cannot go wrong with Hendrickson's Corner!

data.title: A Local's Delight
data.text: I love this place! It has so much character and it's quite the charming little place. My boyfriend and I stop in at the bar for just drinks but also eat here often and have never been disappointed. Service is pretty good too- i like the bartenders a lot. My go to app are the nachos and I get them every time! It's made with a sweet chili, delish, and the portion to share for 2 or 3 people is just right. Prices are great too!

data.title: Cozy Neighborhood Spot
data.text: I'm a frequenter of this spot in Bayonne.  It's one of our favorite restaurants in the area.  The service is always very friendly and the bartenders are great.  It's an older place, but has a lot of charm to it.  The burgers are great and the Sauerbraten is delicious!  There's a great selection of beer on tap and the menu is fairly large and always great!

data.title: A neighborhood gem
data.text: Hendrickson's corner has ambiance, charm,great service and delicious food. I visited this restaurant with 4 other couples and was pleasantly surprised....the wait staff was very attentive. The food came out in a timely manner and was absolutely delicious. I had the chicken zinfandel and my husband had the sizzling garlic steak...yum!

data.title: Excellent old fashioned tavern
data.text: Great food. Highly recommend the crab cakes. The menu is very varied, and the service is always friendly and helpful. A local favorite.

data.title: I love hendricksons!!!
data.text: This is my favorite restaurant. It's a family owned place, everyone is very friendly. They do not rush you out, and the service is great. The food is consistent, it's always good! Sauerbraten is one of the best things on the menu, but the burgers are really good too. Come here with an appetite.

data.title: This place is ok
data.text: It's ok I think it's under new ownership and they really downsized the menu. The atmosphere is the only thing that makes this place unique.

data.title: Surprisingly good--a good chef cooks here. Stuffed flounder and chicken Parm winners
data.text:
Stopped by for dinner after touring through Bayonne with family members who lived there. Upon entering you'd expect it just to be bar quality food. Much to my surprise the food was cooked better than most "restaurants" I've eaten at in my lifetime. 

During our visit our party ordered cheeseburgers, chicken Parm, stuffed flounder, French onion soup, chili and potato pancakes. 

The cheeseburgers were cooked to the proper doneness. Fries were "steak style"--large and served lukewarm. Burgers were good but not great. Chili had mixed review -- it was thick and a bit too sweet (brown sugar was used I think). but the surprise is how good the flounder and chicken Parm was. 

Walking into a pub you'd expect the burgers to be the highlight -- simple to make for a chef at a bar. But the real gems were the flounder and chicken Parm. The flounder was ordered with light Lemon butter sauce and this request was carried out perfectly. The crab used to in the stuffing of the flounder was spiced very well--flavor of dill and old bay complimented the crab meat. Bits of celery offered a nice crunch. 

The chicken Parm was a more than generous offering--larger than many Italian places throughout NJ. Bold flavor and a generous portion--order this or the flounder.

Potato cakes were good but nothing amazing. Done right, but just not as good as the flounder. 

Service was a bit slow.

data.title: Historic Pub in Midtown Bayonne
data.text: I had lunch with a friend at Hendrickson's today, which is walking distance from my home. The interior really reminds me of a traditional British pub. Choices are pretty extensive for a lunch menu. I had the onion soup au gratin and the portobello philly cheesesteak sandwich, which was served with steak fries, pickle, and cole slaw. My friend had chili with nachos and the sliders, also served with steak fries, pickle, and cole slaw. We both had Spaten Oktoberfest beers with our meal. Food was excellent and service from the charming waitress, Barbara, was attentive. I'd certainly return, for lunch or dinner.

data.title: Very Impressed
data.text: I was there for Dinner on October 7 for their special German menu. I had the german fries on the side and the Pork Bratwurst w/ sauerkraut on a potato bun. The Bratwurst was absolutely thick, juicy and tasty. They paired it with a Spaten Oktoberfest beer. Would definitely recommend it. I would have gotten the Pork Schnitzel (2 thick pieces of porkchops with a delish mushroom gravy; which I glanced at the guy next to me devoured) However the portion was a  little too much for me last night. Would definitely go back.

data.title: Was not impressed
data.text: They have a special German menu on Wednesdays for October. Added a pork schnitzel on the entree menu side. Sauerbraten on regular menu. Was not impressed. 2 thin pieces of pork can't gaurantee they weren't packaged. Red cabbage was same sweet jar that you can buy in supermarket. Mashed potato were made fresh, could use more of mushroom sauce they put on meat. All the regulars seem to have there own special meal they like to order. The bratwurst looked like a pathetic hotdog. Service was very slow, drinks are pricey.

data.title: A charming pub with consistently good food
data.text: Whenever my adult children return to Bayonne they always request lunch at Hendrickson's.  Hendrickson's sliced steak sandwich is a family favorite.  Nobody serves a more delectable steak sandwich with accompanying salad than Hendrickson's.  Wait staff is always pleasant. Have been told that there are many delicious other food choices on their menu, but I recommend the steak

data.title: Taste the Soup!
data.text: Don't worry, the spoon will be there.  You'll find us at the bar, and more than likely I'm having their world class Onion Soup.  It's fantastic, as are all their soups, all their burgers, and the enormous Hendrickson's Salad, which is topped with slices of beef and some of the best pork lardons we've ever had.  The vibe is great, and the owners are top-notch straight-up guys.  If we're not home, we're probably at Hendrickson's Corner!  And PS: the Grey Goose Martini's are excellent, as are the bartenders who serve them.

data.title: A Real Pub Restaurant With Old World Charm.
data.text: We had dinner there on St. Patrick's Day. The beer was flowing as well as all types of wines and liquors. We ate in the dining room that has an atmosphere of an old world Pub. They had a special with pea soup and corned beef and cabbage and some really excellent potatoes. The service was excellent and the food even better. Prices were reasonable and very affordable.  The wait staff treats you as family and everyone leaves extremely satisfied.
